name: Network Authentication & Access Control
description: Sector template for network-level authentication, authorization, and access control patents including identity management, SSO, OAuth, firewalls, and certificate-based security.
contextDescription: Network authentication and access control patents cover identity verification, session management, access policies, and perimeter security. Key technologies include LDAP, RADIUS, OAuth, SAML, PKI certificates, firewalls, VPNs, zero-trust architectures, SASE, SD-WAN, and container security.
scoringGuidance: Authentication patents should be scored on their resistance to credential theft, replay attacks, and session hijacking.
Access control patents focusing on policy granularity and dynamic authorization score higher.
Zero-trust architecture patents that eliminate implicit trust should score highly on access_control_model.
Patents with broad protocol support (SAML, OAuth, OIDC) score higher on protocol_scope.
Cloud-native and SASE-aligned patents addressing hybrid connectivity are high value in current market.
Container/microservices security patents that bridge orchestration with access control are emerging high-value areas.

questions.question: What type of authentication mechanism does this patent cover? Score 1-3 for single-factor (password only), 4-6 for multi-factor (2FA, MFA), 7-10 for advanced/continuous authentication (biometric, behavioral, risk-based).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe the authentication factors and mechanism sophistication.

questions.question: How comprehensive is the identity management capability? Score 1-3 for basic user/password, 4-6 for enterprise IAM (SSO, federation), 7-10 for comprehensive identity governance (provisioning, lifecycle, privileged access).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess the scope of identity management from basic to full lifecycle.

questions.question: What access control model is implemented? Score 1-3 for simple ACLs, 4-6 for RBAC (role-based), 7-10 for advanced models (ABAC, policy-based, zero-trust).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the access control paradigm and its flexibility.

questions.question: How well does the patent align with or extend authentication standards? Score 1-3 if proprietary only, 4-6 for single standard (OAuth, SAML), 7-10 for multi-protocol or standards-essential.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify relevant standards: OAuth, SAML, OIDC, FIDO, Kerberos, RADIUS, etc.

questions.question: Does this patent address network perimeter security? Score 1-3 for host-only, 4-6 for network segment/VPN, 7-10 for enterprise-wide perimeter (next-gen firewall, SASE, SD-WAN security).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess network perimeter coverage from host to enterprise-wide.

questions.question: Does this patent address cloud or hybrid connectivity scenarios? Score 1-3 if not applicable, 4-6 for basic cloud integration, 7-10 for SASE, SD-WAN, or multi-cloud access control.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess cloud-native, hybrid cloud, or SASE/SD-WAN applicability.

questions.question: Does this patent address container orchestration or microservices security? Score 1-3 if not applicable, 4-6 for container-aware access control, 7-10 for Kubernetes/service mesh integration.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess container, Kubernetes, or service mesh security applicability.
